quote_first: We breakfasted together in the cottage - grapefruit, toast, and coffee - and then I came out to the surgery to wait for Oliver. He was due to give blood at nine. When he hadn’t arrived by
quote_last: , I began ringing round to find out what was keeping him.
title: The Lighthouse
author: P.D. James

quote_first: Here Miss Wharton, as was her custom each Wednesday and Friday, would weed out the dead flowers from the vase in front of the statue of the Virgin, scrape the wax and candle stubs from the brass holders, dust the two rows of chairs in the Lady Chapel, which would be adequate for the small congregation expected at that morning’s early Mass, and make everything ready for the arrival at
title: A Taste for Death
